meta_description: Yale University Art Gallery is the oldest college art museum in America. FREE and open to the public
hours_text:
The Gallery is free and open to the public from Tuesday through Sunday.

## Hours

Tuesday–Friday| 10:00 am–5:00 pm  
---|---  
Thursday (Aug. 28–June 25)| 10:00 am–8:00 pm  
Saturday–Sunday| 11:00 am–5:00 pm  
  
Closed Mondays (except for [Yale Commencement](https://commencement.yale.edu)) and on these major holidays: New Year’s Day, Juneteenth (June 19), Fourth of July, Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Eve, and Christmas Day

## Admission

The Gallery is free and open to the public.

Access the free [Smartify app](https://artgallery.yale.edu/visit/mobile-app), where you can find the museum’s floor plan and other resources to help guide your visit.

## Location

We are located at 1111 Chapel Street between York and High Streets in New Haven, Conn. For custom driving, public transportation, and walking directions to the Gallery, [use Google Maps](https://goo.gl/maps/EkXkncibay62).

## Frequently Asked Questions

Where can I park? 

Visitors can park in metered spaces on nearby streets or in the Chapel-York Garage, conveniently located at 150 York Street.

Due to a change in management at the Chapel-York Garage, **we are no longer able to validate tickets** in order to provide discounted parking for Gallery members.

Where is the accessible entrance? 

An elevator opposite the main entrance at 1111 Chapel Street is wheelchair accessible.  
[Learn more about on-site accessibility](/visit/accessibility)

Can I check personal items? 

Lockers are available on a limited basis. Large b...

accessibility_text:
# Accessibility at Yale 

To report a disability-related accessibility issue on a Yale website or web application, please use the [Accessibility Comments Form](https://yale.service-now.com/it?id=accessibility_comments).

## Website Accessibility

As part of [Yale’s mission](https://www.yale.edu/about-yale/mission-statement), Yale is committed to “the free exchange of ideas in an ethical, interdependent, and diverse community.” That diversity includes all people regardless of ability or disability.

Websites and web applications are integral to the university’s academic and administrative work. Yale is committed to making information, programs and activities on its websites and web applications accessible to people with disabilities through its [Web Accessibility Policy](https://your.yale.edu/policies-procedures/policies/1605-web-accessibility-policy).

The Web Accessibility Policy applies to websites and applications that conduct university business. Owners of such sites should be familiar with this policy and the [Web Accessibility Procedure](https://your.yale.edu/policies-procedures/procedures/1605-pr01-web-accessibility-procedure). The policy may also affect people in roles that work on university websites. People in roles that work on University websites and web applications should explore this website and take advantage of [Yale’s accessibility best practices](/web-accessibility/articles/learning-accessibility) and [trainings](/web-accessibility/training-0).

collections_text:
# Welcome to Yale University Art Gallery

## [ Exhibition : Hans Hofmann November 7, 2025 – June 28, 2026  Yale University Art Gallery  ](/exhibitions/exhibition/hans-hofmann)

###  Exhibition : [Keeping Alive the Remembrance: Commemorating America's Founding, 1776–1876](/exhibitions/exhibition/keeping-alive-remembrance-commemorating-americas-founding-1776-1876)

November 7, 2025 – October 11, 2026 

###  Exhibition : [American Impressionism](/exhibitions/exhibition/american-impressionism)

December 19, 2025 – June 14, 2026 

## Visit the Gallery

The Gallery is free and open to the public from Tuesday through Sunday.

[ Plan your visit  ](/visit#Hours)

## Upcoming Programs

###  Tours  [Highlights Tours](/calendar/events/highlights-tours-7)

###  Tours  [Highlights Tours](/calendar/events/highlights-tours-8)

Sunday, January 18, 2026, 1:30 pm – 2:30 pm

###  Tours  [Highlights Tours](/calendar/events/highlights-tours-7)

Sunday, January 18, 2026, 2:30 pm – 3:30 pm

[ View all events ](/visit/calendar)

## Browse the Collection

Find details about more than 190,000 objects, starting with our highlights.
